column1: The Appledore Family were a family of Big Folk who lived in Bree. Only one member of the family is known
column3: who was killed in fighting at Bree during the War of the Ring.

column1: Appledore is an old word for "apples" and survives in English place-names. It represents a dialectal or archaic word of the same meaning in Westron.J.R.R. Tolkien
column3: "Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings"
column4: published in A Tolkien Compass (edited by Jared Lobdell)
